ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Not Download Duplicate files
ygData.msgSnippet: I recommend beginners use Heritrix 1.14.x versions; there is better documentation and fewer gotchas when customizing the configuration. I can t tell from the

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Not Download Duplicate files
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=BR7xSnvNemcLxOhgOiA3pe5WpjtcUTt-aTt8xboijlxf
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

I recommend beginners use Heritrix 1.14.x versions; there is better 
documentation and fewer gotchas when customizing the configuration. I 
can't tell from the error stack you forwarded what is goin wrong with 
your launch.

FYI, discarding content duplicates only happens on the second or later 
repeated crawls, after saving some of the state from an earlier crawl 
and providing it to the followup crawl.

The general approach supported by 1.12+ is described here:

http://webteam.archive.org/confluence/display/Heritrix/Feature+Notes+-+1.12.0

- Gordon @ IA

Miguel Olivares wrote:
> Hi,
> I'm a begginer with Heritrix and I want to discard the files with the 
> same digest
> I'm using Heritrix 2.0.0, this is my configuration:
> 
> 
> root=map, java.lang.Object
> root:metadata=primary, org.archive.modules.writer.DefaultMetadataProvider
> root:metadata:description=string, Basic seeds sites crawl.
> root:metadata:operator-contact-url=string, http://www.example.com
> root:metadata:robots-honoring-policy=primary, 
> org.archive.modules.net.RobotsHonoringPolicy
> root:metadata:robots-honoring-policy:user-agents=list, java.lang.String
> root:loggerModule=primary, org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlerLoggerModule
> root:seeds=primary, org.archive.modules.seeds.SeedModuleImpl
